content.label:
Bought this game for the nostalgia. Ran into black screens for every chapter and any video action scenes. Including the ending credits which I enjoyed hearing/watching back in the DS days. BUT couldn’t enjoy any of that due to said black screens that would run for so long until the next chapter to begin. 

The game also lags every so often. 

Tl;dr
Don’t buy the game for IOS. They haven’t even updated this game since 4 years ago. Was hoping it’d just be one small glitch with the black screens, but it’s all throughout the game. Save yourself.

title.label: Time has ruined one of the best games ever...

content.label: This is hands down the best port of this great game however square many years ago has stopped updating this game and apple did not stop updating their devices. Don’t buy this unless it gets a more recent update than 4 years ago as you literally can’t start the game due to it crashing upon hitting new game. If you have a DS get it there and it’s honestly better than the switch port but if you have no other choice go to switch.
Thanks I spent all my money for a game that doesn’t work refund me or make it work

The World Ends With You is an incredible game and one all rpg fans should check out. I played the ds version and I played this version years ago. The story is great and the game was fun to play. The solo version was a good rendition of the game. 

Unfortunately this game no longer works on iOS 13. It seems to be a problem with certain cutscenes, so you can barely start a new game and cannot finish the game due to this bug. This makes the game nearly unplayable, especially since you can’t see the key parts of the storyline, which is one of the highlights of the game. Be wary if you are considering buying on iOS unless a bug fix is released (which given the last update was over 2 years ago, seems unlikely.)
Hi, i have an Iphone max with the 13.3 ios. And the game doesn’t start. Don’t pass the start screen. Can you please fix?

It doesn’t support the latest ios, so even if it says that your phone is supported on the app page, it’s not taking ios13 into account.

title.label: The DEFINITIVE Version of the Game

content.label:
Or the best one out of the three.   TWEWY is an amazing game and story.  If you have a chance to play it you should!  The story is interesting and the location of Shibuya comes alive. 

On why this is the best version of the game:  I have played this game on all systems it has come on.  
•The DS graphics are just a little tired and needing to “mingle” with other people IRL playing it for LVing up certain pins makes it hard and time consuming.  (But it can be done given just lots of time waiting)  And sometimes playing on both screens doing different things can give you a headache.  Over all though it’s a lot of fun. 
•This app has updated graphics and increased the storyline a little.  All the pins still LV up in the same way as before.  When you need to “mingle” just play TinPin Slammer.  I find this to be the easiest of all the versions to play overall.  However this app did stop working a few years ago after a iOS update and it took SquareEnix months to get it working again.  But this is also the cheapest of all the versions as well.  I don’t think that will happen again however. 
•The Switch version of TWEWY is the newest but uses the same graphics as the app.  (Its mainly a port of the app with another small epilogue added to hint at another game that may or may not come)  It also changes how you LV up certain pins by totally removing “mingle” points.  Not a difficult thing to deal with but it is worth mentioning.  The problem with the Switch version of this game is the controls.  None of them want to work!  Touchscreen works the most like the older versions.  Trying to used a controller means only using 1 and motion control which is a little wonky.   Switch is also currently the most expensive. 

I hope this helps other people decide what version of this wonderful game they want to play.

title.label: Maybe it’s because I didn’t download the version for iPad

content.label: But this version is missing a lot and I know that the mobile version is not supposed to look like this. I’m missing basically every cutscene in the game and even redownloading the app didn’t work. It’s a shame because I’ve been very interested in playing the game for so long only to pay almost $20.00 for an incomplete version.

content.label: The graphics are crisp and clear and it’s easier to play now that you can just control both characters on the same screen. Doesn’t lag and the sound is as great as ever!!  A+

title.label: Great game, needs iCloud and iPhone X support!

content.label: Two things stop this from being rated higher for me. Firstly, this is a fantastic game and I am glad it is available on iOS. However, it needs to be updated to support the X and XS’ larger display... even if that’s just a border like Capcom has done with some of their premium games. Secondly, a premium game at this cost needs to support iCloud. Especially an RPG. If you fix these two things I will happily raise my score Square-Enix!

title.label: No music.. What is going on?

content.label: Playing on the iPhone 7+ running IOS 11.3.1... Also this mobile game along with Chrono Trigger is no loner playing the soundtrack. Can this please be looked into? I would greatly appreciate it.

My homies, this is a good heckin' game. Definitely easier than the original ds version, but who owns those anymore? Anyways, the controls are tight (except scratch commands, never figured those out). Pictures look kinda grainy sometimes, probably because it was ported. Gotta say though, the story is really good, and the ending made me cry my eyes out

title.label: Great game if you havent played the OG DS version

content.label: Other than that anyone having problems with ios11 not downloading the game. I keep getting an “we’re unable to download at this time.”

title.label: Need to implement a Progress Save system for iCloud or Game Center.

content.label: Really don’t want to start over when I just switched phones.

title.label: I have been waiting ten years...

content.label:
I lost my DS or my cousin stole it... anyways I’ve been waiting a very very long time to finish this game. I used to think about it all the time and contemplated buying a DS just to finish it up. I had reached the final boss, and I never got the chance to see the end because... well I just said it!

Anyways, super happy I purchased this. Super happy that I stayed up until 5 am to finish the game. It took me around two-three days to get through the whole thing. 

I really wish this would have been made into a manga or an anime, definitely would have rocked my world. But I guess from what I read it didn’t do too well in Japan. 

As for the game play, I loved how everything was so nice and simple for the most part. My only issue is all the different movements you have to do on the screen with your finger tips because of the different pins, sometimes they just don’t work or you have to do it over and over and so that stopped me from using certain pins just so I could battle faster and not worry about annoying pins. 

Also, working with Shiki was GREAT, working with Joshua was also simple, but the controls for Beat really need some work... like REALLY badly. Summoning him into battle and even pressing down during the final boss, it DOES NOT work.

Other than that... IM SO HAPPY!!!! 

Definitely one of my favorite games of all time.

title.label: Great, but sadly the original is better.

content.label: The game feels right at home on the IOS, and the changes to the combat are great, but they make the game a very different beast than the DS version, which emphasized multitasking. The game’s graphics are crisp and clean, at times perhaps too much so, that the game feels slightly “off” in some way. The remastered tracks are great, and the new music is just as good, but the placement of said music is absolutely horrible at times, with the game often playing tunes that just don’t fit. A solid game, but not as good as the original, which is sad because it could have been great with a bit more polish.

If you are looking for a game that has great gameplay, an amazing plot, and tons of replay value, then this is the game for you. I have already put 40+ hours into this game and still haven't gotten everything. Only thing I could wish for is a sequel, but even without one, there is nearly endless gameplay with over 100 different pins to use.

Only negative is that the restore IAP button doesn’t restore IAP purchases. Will rate 5 stars if fixed.
Great game so far, but I noticed the sound cuts off a lot.  Needs a iOS 11 update and a iPhone X support.

I bought this game when it first came out for the DS years ago and was ecstatic when I found out this was released for mobile.

The story elements are all the same and they revamped the fighting to be better suited for one screen. The graphics are slightly improved from 8-bit to a smoother appearance.

HOWEVER. This mobile port is not without its annoyances: when I first started the game, none of the extra sound effects (voice exclamations during scenes and fighting, the little “tick” noise after text bubbles) disappeared. I’d close out the app and open it up again and 1 of 3 things could happen at any given restart: the voice acting and extra sound effects were restored, or they were not, or the voice acting was there and the background music was not. If the music and characters weren’t such an integral part of this gameplay experience, this wouldn’t bother me, but alas, they are. Sometimes push notifications from my other apps will pop up and I accidentally leave this game, resulting in the same glitches when I come back. Pile this on with the autosave feature and sometimes there are whole cutscenes I’ll have to repeat again. Additional gameplay bug: Neku is supposed to have a dodge feature when you swipe over him during a fight, but this often registers as a pin attack and I often get attacked instead of dodging like I wanted. This last complaint isn’t that bad considering this was somewhat of a problem in the DS version too, however.

All in all, I’d say this revamp of one of my all time favorite games is still worth it and fun to play. But you’ll need some serious patience when the music and sound effects can’t keep up.
Great game, love the gameplay and the soundtrack. I just wish I could hear it, due to the voices being sped up and glitchy. Please fix it.
Heya, can you guys update the app for IOS 11 please? TWEWY is one of the reasons I'm not updating to IOS 11. One of the best games ever
I love this game a lot, and I’d like to play it on my new iPhone X. When do you think you’ll be updating it for the new screen?

I will always like the ds version, but the mobile is better in the fact the you don't control 2 characters at once. I could never get around that, so I always had the CPU takeover at the start of battle. I'm glad they changed that in this version.
